newsitem.title: FINLAND: Nokia says to extend Geoworks coop.
newsitem.headline: Nokia says to extend Geoworks coop.

text.p: Finnish telecommunications group Nokia Oy said on Wednesday it had signed an agreement with U.S. software group Geoworks to extend cooperation in developing new intelligent wireless devices and systems.
"This agreement reinforces the two companies' commitment to grow the enhanced communicator and intelligent mobile phone market," it said in a statement.
Nokia said the deal continued a relationship formed with Geoworks during development of its wireless voice, data and fax mobile the Nokia 9000 Communicator, using Geoworks GEOS operating system.

"In addition, Nokia and Geoworks are working on delivering wireless content and service solutions that provide value-added services including remote shopping, telebanking, and access to Internet information and entertainment," the statement said.
